nodes.text: [Warning: Graphic Video] A 24-year-old man died after a San Diego Metro transit officer knelt on his neck for over 6 minutes, months before George Floyd's murder.\n\n"Angel, are you alive?" an officer is seen asking in bodycam footage as Angel Zapata Hernandez lay unconscious. https://t.co/blC6zbTUNZ

@ajplus . “ I can’t breath” , said Angel Zapata, while San Diego police hand cuff and kneel on him for 6.12 seconds.  Repeatedly Asking him for his birthday,... gasps for air and goes Dead, but no out rage in California.  #ICantBreathe
@ajplus You see plainly the officers knee was on his arm!!!
@ajplus WITH ALL THESE KNEEDOWN KILLINGS. makes me wonder how all these police do it but theyre NOT TRAINED THAT WAY....
@ajplus Nobody is going to care because he's the "wrong" skin color.
@AZ831300 @ajplus Are you even able to drive in your country? Mind your own business
@ajplus This made me sick to my stomach. POC constantly dying over nothing while mass murderers are taken into custody with not a scratch on them. This shit has to stop!

@ajplus Angel Zapata Hernandez:  "Stop, please, I just need to breathe"\nSan Diego Metro transit police officer  "Angel, you still alive there, dude?"\nTransit police knelt on the 24-year olds neck for over 6 minutes.
